stories.title: In 2009, Two Nuclear Submarines Collided Under the Sea

stories.text:
We are developing an internal app for the needs of our business operations team and we would like to add a task management system to it.

The idea is the same as what you can have on CRM tools such as Hubspot or Pipedrive. Is there a way to do that with an existing API that we would plug and adapt?
stories.title: Ask HN: Task Management API

stories.text:
I'm off track because I'm slow. I'm slow because of context switching (fullstack in multiple stacks and working in several different systems with frequent switching). There's nothing the team can do about the context switching. My manager agrees with all this. My conclusion is to leave the team for a team environment more conducive to my development. This won't be allowed because we have 4 unfilled positions from people leaving over the past few months, which leaves me (midlevel), a junior, and a contractor who's term is up in Nov and can't be extended.

So I'm too valuable to be allowed to go to another team, but I'm not valuable enough to recieve an average rating. I'm also being told to stay in a team that is detrimental to my progression. This team also doesn't have a senior dev or tech lead to provide guidance. Oh, and the team is expected to absorb the tech lead functions while we don't have one.

I'd say I'm safe from being fired for the next few months while they try to fill all these positions, but I'm afraid of the longterm consequences of telling the truth and speaking my mind. I was almost fired once for similarly telling the truth in a skip level.
stories.title: Tell HN: I'm going to be so screwed for telling the truth in my skip level
